problem.p:
An experienced skier knows how to gain speed while skiing over a small dips of snow. The trick is to jump in the air and land smoothly on the slope downward.
Here a skier traveling at velocity v wants to jump up and smoothly land on a dip that makes an angle b with the horizontal. For what distance d back from the dip should the skier jump up into the air in order to make smooth landing?
Use g for the gravitational constant.
Tip: be sure to write trigonometric functions in the form sin(b) or tan(b).
